se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules

Class RestrictImplDependencies

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules.AbstractEnforcerRule
      • se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules.AbstractNonCacheableEnforcerRule
        • se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules.RestrictImplDependencies
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRule

    public class RestrictImplDependencies
extends AbstractNonCacheableEnforcerRule
    Enforcer rule to restrict importing Impl projects with the exception of actual JEE deployment projects.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

      • EVALUATE_GROUPID

        public static final String EVALUATE_GROUPID
        Pattern defining groupID for artifacts that should be evaluated by this EnforcerRule instance. This default value will be used unless overridden by [explicit] configuration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IGNORE_GROUPID

        public static final String IGNORE_GROUPID
        Pattern defining patterns for groupIDs that should be ignored by this EnforcerRule instance. This default value will be used unless overridden by [explicit] configuration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getShortRuleDescription

        protected final String getShortRuleDescription()

        getShortRuleDescription in class AbstractEnforcerRule
        Returns:

      • setIncludedGroupIdPatterns

        public final void setIncludedGroupIdPatterns(String includedGroupIdPatterns)

        Assigns a set of patterns defining included GroupIds. Any projects whose GroupID match any of the provided includedGroupIdPatterns will be validated by this rule.

        A typical configuration of this property within a pom is similar to below:

        [includedGroupIdPatterns]^se\\.jguru\\.nazgul\\..*[/includedGroupIdPatterns];
        Parameters:
        includedGroupIdPatterns - Comma-separated list of regexp patterns that groupID should match to be included in enforcement.

      • setExcludedGroupIdPatterns

        public final void setExcludedGroupIdPatterns(String excludedGroupIdPatterns)
        Assigns a (comma separated) list of regexp patterns defining excluded GroupIds. Any projects whose GroupID match any of the provided excludedGroupIdPatterns will not be validated by this rule.

        A typical configuration of this property within a pom is similar to below (but using normal 'less-than' and 'greater-than' tag demarcation):

        <excludedGroupIdPatterns>^se\\.jguru\\.nazgul\\..\*\.generated\\..*, ^se\\.jguru\\.nazgul\\.tools\\.codestyle\\..*</excludedGroupIdPatterns>
        Parameters:
        excludedGroupIdPatterns - Comma-separated list of groupID prefixes that should be excluded from enforcement.
